snippet: John A. Catsimatidis, a Republican mayoral hopeful, has a fondness for the word “hoodlum,” mentioning it in televised debates, at events for supporters and on Twitter.
abstract: Trailside blog; John A Catsimatidis, Republican candidate for New York City mayor, has been remarkably on-message about being 'anti-hoodlum' throughout his entire campaign; says his fondness for the word 'hoodlum' stems from his 1950s upbringing.
lead_paragraph: John A. Catsimatidis, a Republican mayoral hopeful, has a fondness for the word “hoodlum,” mentioning it in televised debates, at events for supporters and on Twitter.

headline.print_headline: He’s Against Hoodlums, And Makes Sure You Know
